channel.title: World News - Breaking international news and headlines | Sky News

image.title: World News - Breaking international news and headlines | Sky News

channel.description: The latest international news from Sky, featuring top stories from around the world and breaking news, as it happens.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2021, Sky UK. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: 'She laid down her life': Husband vows to continue wife's rescue work in 'this pointless war'
item.description: From the most dangerous areas around Kharkiv there is an almost constant exodus of people fleeing homes they cannot be sure they will ever see again.
item.media:description: Oleg and Yulia Koval had returned to Kharkiv to help people when they were caught up in an explosion

item.title: Russia denies Mariupol steel plant ground assault amid claims Putin wants success ahead of Victory Day
item.description: Heavy fighting is continuing at the besieged steel plant in Mariupol as Russian forces attempt to complete the capture of the strategically vital port.
item.media:description: An aerial view of a possible shelling of Azovstal complex, in Mariupol, Ukraine, in this still image from a handout video acquired by Reuters on May 5, 2022. Ministry of Internal Affairs Donetsk People's Republic/Handout via REUTERS THIS IMAGE HAS BEEN SUPPLIED BY A THIRD PARTY

item.title: Three stabbed to death in 'terror attack' near Tel Aviv - as Israeli police hunt suspect
item.description: Three people have been killed and four others wounded in a stabbing attack in a town near Tel Aviv, Israeli medics said.

item.title: Woman pulled alive from rubble six days after building collapsed
item.description: A woman has been found alive in the rubble of a building that partially collapsed almost six days earlier, Chinese state media has said.
item.media:description: Rescue workers evacuate the 10th survivor pulled alive after being trapped 132 hours in the debris

item.title: Pope Francis seen using wheelchair for the first time for mobility reasons
item.description: The Pope has been pictured using a wheelchair - the first time he's used one in public due to the knee pain that's made it hard for him to walk and stand.
item.media:description: Pope Francis arrives on a wheelchair to meet with participants in the plenary assembly of the International Union of Superiors General (IUSG) at the Vatican, May 5, 2022. REUTERS/Guglielmo Mangiapane

item.title: WHO estimates 15m people have died directly or indirectly from COVID - more than double official death toll
item.description: The World Health Organisation estimates that 15 million people worldwide have now died of coronavirus - or as a result of its impact on health services.
item.media:description: Bereaved families walk past London's COVID Memorial Wall in March this year

item.title: Briton who joined Ukrainian regiment with far-right origins says they're not 'monsters and psychos'
item.description: A British man who joined a controversial Ukrainian military unit says he is willing to spend the next year defending against Russia's invasion - and he has not been deterred by the capture of other Britons.

item.title: Europe's mission to Mars 'could be on hold for years' due to Ukraine war
item.description: Europe's mission to search for evidence of life on Mars is likely to be on hold for several years as a result of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Sky News has been told.
item.media:description: This undated artist rendition provided by the European Space Agency shows the ESA ExoMars robot on Mars. Because of the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Europe will no longer be attempting to send its first rover to Mars this year. The European Space Agency confirmed Thursday March 17, 2022 that it is indefinitely suspending its ExoMars rover mission with partner Roscosmos, Russia's state space corporation. (Thiebaut/ESA-AOES medialab via AP) PICAP

item.title: White House names first Black woman and openly LGBTQ press secretary
item.description: Joe Biden has named Karine Jean-Pierre to be the next White House press secretary, the first Black woman and openly LGBTQ person to serve in the role.
item.media:description: Karine Jean-Pierre has been named the next White House press secretary

item.title: Russia accused of targeting hospitals in 'terror bombing' campaign
item.description: Almost four attacks a day have been carried out against medics and healthcare facilities in Ukraine on average since the war began, according to Sky News analysis.
